required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Hybrid Combination of CCTA and SPECT and CAG for Evaluation Prognosis of CAD: an Observational Follow-up Study
clinical_study.official_title: The First Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: A total of 550 patients with stable angina (40-70% stenosis) tested by coronary CT angiography (CCTA) and single photon emission computed tomography (SPECT) and coronary angiography (CAG) within 3 months were retrospectively recruited from 2005 to 2015 and follow up to 5 years. A new hybrid software was used to analysis the image data.

primary_outcome.description: All-cause death, cardiac death, ischemic stroke, unplanned revascularization and nonfatal myocardial infarction

study_pop.textblock: Patients who were suspected coronary artery disease and underwent CCTA, SPECT and CAG within 3 months from 2005 to 2015.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age: 18-70
2. Gender: All
3. coronary artery disease patients (CAD)
4. underwent CCTA, SPECT and coronary angiography (CAG) together within 3 months
5. Time: 2005-2015
Exclusion Criteria:
1. dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM), hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM), congenital heart disease (CHD), atrial fibrillation (AF), ventricular tachycardia (VT)
2. Prior coronary revascularization;
3. permanent pacemaker or internal defibrillator
4. prosthetic heart valve
5. coronary image lose
6. coronary artery severe calcification
7. motion artifacts and poor CCTA image quality

overall_official.affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital Hospital of Nanjing Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

patient_data.ipd_description: The hybrid software will be uploaded to the open internet. Cardiologist could upload their patients' image data and the hybrid results will be proved.
